section.title: Representing Arrays
section.simpara: The array data structure is the most critical structure in the system, and deserves careful consideration. The following table details the fields of the array structure and all the elements necessary to construct a valid array structure.

tr.td: The count of the dimensions of the array
The count of the elements in the array
The type of the array elements
A pointer to the dimensions; each dimension is a 32-bit unsigned integer
A pointer to the buffer containing the elements; the nature of the elements is dependent on the Type
A pointer to the types of the elements in a mixed array; only necessary for mixed arrays
